articles.title: Single-cell RNA-seq Workshop
articles.contents:
November 1st - 5th, 2021 
5-day workshop covering methods used to analyze single cell RNA-seq data using R/RStudio. The course will be held in person on the Anschutz campus (Ed2N building P28-CTL-2201AB Computer Lab).
Prerequisites
A basic understanding of the R programming language and a single cell RNA-seq dataset to analyze. Individuals without R experience will need to complete online courses suggested by instructors. The single cell RNA-seq dataset can be from a public resource, or private data from a lab on campus. The instructors will provide specific recommendations for preferred data formats, dataset size and complexity.
Register
Please fill out this form to indicate your interest in the workshop. Selected attendees will be notified by October 1.
Schedule
Pre-class videos (< 30 min) with lecture and background material will be provided prior to each day’s workshop.
Session 0 | November 1th, 9:00am - 11:00am
Course on-boarding session for those with questions on prerequisite material

Session 1 | November 2th, 9:00am - 11:00am
Introduction to single cell RNA-seq
Processing scRNA-seq data: from FASTQ to a count matrix
Interacting with single cell data in R
Quality control

Session 2 | November 3th, 9:00am - 11:00am
Dimensionality reduction techniques for scRNA-seq (PCA, UMAP, tSNE, etc)
Clustering scRNA-seq data
Differential expression and marker gene discovery
Cell-type annotation

Session 3 | November 4th, 9:00am - 11:00am
Using pseudotime approaches to find trajectories or gene expression gradients
Working with multi-sample datasets and mitigating batch effects

Session 4 | November 5th, 9:00am - 11:00am
Incorporating additional single cell modalities, e.g. CITE-seq
Additional time to discuss personal datasets

Office hours
An instructor will be available after class for an hour to assist with additional questions. Additional office hours may be scheduled by contacting workshop instuctors, or scheduled through the RBI office hours.
Instructors
Please contact the RBI fellows (rbi.fellows@cuanschutz.edu) if you have questions.
Ryan Sheridan
Caitlin Winkler
Tyler Matheny
Kristen Wells-Wrasman
Rui Fu
Kent Riemondy
